complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down environment setup into configuration file creation, module installation, TypeScript integration, and security setup. Focus on Nuxt 4 compatibility and @nuxtjs/supabase v2 configuration patterns.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Low complexity due to greenfield project, modern tooling (@nuxtjs/supabase handles most complexity), and clear documentation. Main work involves file creation and configuration rather than complex logic.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Structure database creation around table design, constraint setup, RLS policy implementation, indexing strategy, and TypeScript type generation. Consider performance optimization and security best practices.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium complexity requiring understanding of PostgreSQL, RLS policies, and proper indexing. Supabase SQL editor simplifies deployment, but security policies require careful design for multi-user isolation.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break authentication into page creation using @nuxt/ui forms, Supabase Auth integration, email verification flow, password recovery, and middleware setup. Focus on UX and security best practices.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium-low complexity with @nuxtjs/supabase handling most auth complexity. Main work involves form creation with @nuxt/ui and proper middleware setup. Email flows add some complexity but are well-documented.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Core API Routes and Server Functions
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Structure API development around server directory setup, validation schema creation, CRUD endpoint implementation, business logic enforcement, and performance optimization. Emphasize security and error handling.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium-high complexity due to server-side business logic, validation schemas, rate limiting, and proper error handling. Nuxt 3+ server directory structure is helpful, but timer validation and security require careful implementation.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Reusable UI Components and Design System
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Organize component development around design system setup, core component creation using @nuxt/ui primitives, timer component with Web Worker, modal system, and theming configuration.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium complexity with @nuxt/ui providing good foundations. Web Worker timer adds complexity, but component structure is straightforward with existing design system components.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break layout development into responsive layout creation, navigation setup using @nuxt/ui, dashboard page implementation, user profile management, and SEO optimization.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium complexity involving responsive design, navigation patterns, and state management. @nuxt/ui NavigationMenu and built-in Nuxt features reduce complexity significantly.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Structure CRUD system around composable state management, form validation with Zod, optimistic updates, confirmation dialogs, and real-time synchronization using Supabase subscriptions.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium-high complexity due to optimistic updates, real-time synchronization, and proper state management. Supabase real-time helps, but conflict resolution and state consistency require careful design.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break timer system into Web Worker implementation, state management composable, start/stop functionality, notification system, and cross-device synchronization. Focus on accuracy and user experience.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: High complexity due to Web Worker implementation, cross-device synchronization, notification system, and timer accuracy requirements. Core business logic with multiple technical challenges including background processing and conflict resolution.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Structure real-time system around connection management, subscription handling, optimistic updates, conflict resolution, and offline/online state management. Emphasize data consistency and user experience.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: High complexity requiring sophisticated state management, conflict resolution strategies, and connection handling. Supabase real-time provides infrastructure, but implementing proper optimistic updates and conflict resolution is challenging.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Organize analytics around Chart.js integration, data aggregation systems, PDF export functionality, CSV export, and sharing mechanisms. Focus on performance and professional presentation.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Medium-high complexity involving data visualization, PDF generation, and sharing systems. Chart.js and jsPDF provide good foundations, but data aggregation and export functionality require careful implementation for performance.
